title: Trichilia silvatica extracts modulate the oxinflammatory response: an in vitro analysis.
abstract: Plants belonging to the Meliaceae family, such as Trichilia silvatica C. DC., known as catigu√°-branco, have attracted considerable interest in phytochemical research due to their diverse and significant secondary metabolites. Trichilia silvatica has traditionally been employed in Brazilian medicine to treat inflammatory disorders. Moreover, studies have reported its antioxidant and antimicrobial properties, highlighting its potential therapeutic applications.
